titleStmt.title: A Declaration of the afflictions and persecution of the Protestants in the marquisate of Saluce, belonging to the Duke of Savoy shewing the faith and constancie of two martyrs put to death for religion in the said marquisate the 21 of October 1619 : also other letters sent to the King from the reformed churches in France, now assembled at Loudun : with an edict made by the French king the ninth of Nouember last past, wherein the Prince of Conde is declared innocent and thereby enlarged of his imprisonment / translated out of French.
titleStmt.author: France. Sovereign (1610-1643 : Louis XIII)

titleStmt.title: A Declaration of the afflictions and persecution of the Protestants in the marquisate of Saluce, belonging to the Duke of Savoy shewing the faith and constancie of two martyrs put to death for religion in the said marquisate the 21 of October 1619 : also other letters sent to the King from the reformed churches in France, now assembled at Loudun : with an edict made by the French king the ninth of Nouember last past, wherein the Prince of Conde is declared innocent and thereby enlarged of his imprisonment / translated out of French.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.

person.persName: Condé, Henri II de Bourbon, prince de,
